results.title: Aluminium in Australia
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: This film tells of the mining of bauxite deposits at Weipa in the far north of Australia - the York Peninsula. The product of this vast mining venture is then transported to Tasmania where it is processed into ingots at the Bell Bay Refinery. From ingots through the rolling mills it is processed into suitable form for the making of a variety of finished products for industry, the home and for commercial buildings. The enormous possibilities of the use of this light, versatile twentieth century metal are shown.

results.title: Aluminium from Mine to Metal
results.brief_description: Gives an overview of Alcoa’s main operations in Australia including the refining of bauxite to alumina in West Australia and the extraction of aluminium at Point Henry, Victoria.

results.title: Alternator 15
results.brief_description: With the tendency of cars to be fitted with more electrical equipment it is becoming increasingly important to fit an alternator rather than a dynamo. This film examines the advantages of an alternator and shows research, aided by computers, into the most acceptable design

results.title: Alternatives: whole school approach to teaching English
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, John Moore and Andrew Scollo
results.brief_description: A program about the importance of language in learning. It shows how three teachers in quite different Melbourne post-primary schools try to meet the language needs of students from non-English-speaking backgrounds.

results.title: Alternative Lifestyles
results.brief_description: From bubble-wrap insulation to a Buddhist stupa, experience alternative living in Mt Best. Meet Dr Chalko and his environmentally sustainable house and see how he converted a freezer into a fridge that uses less power per hour than a light bulb uses per day. Michael and Mary moved to Mt Best to find peace and to live in harmony with their surrounds, in the process they built a Stupa and a labyrinth in their backyard and invite anyone who wishes to come and contemplate a moment of their time.

results.title: Alternative dispute resolution
results.creator_credit: Video Classroom, Geoff Russell and Peter Wiseman
results.brief_description: At some stage in our lives most of us will get caught up in a civil dispute - perhaps involving an employer, a neighbour, our bank, or a complete stranger. Rather than face the daunting, expensive and time-consuming prospect of going to court, in Australia today counselling and mediation are becoming cost-effective alternatives for many smaller civil cases involving a range of disputes. This program - made with the assistance of the Dispute Settlement Centre of Victoria, the Small Claims Tribunal and other relevant civil mediation bodies, uses a dramatised case study (involving a motor vehicle accident) to show how mediation and alternative dispute resolution can help solve a property damage dispute.

results.title: Alternating current and direct current
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare and John Durst
results.brief_description: An outline of the difference between alternating and direct current; why AC is in general use; how DC can be produced from AC; and the reasons why one or the other is used for particular purposes. The film also shows why high tension AC is preferable to low tension DC for transmission purposes.
